df-assa
blocks.content: Definition of an associative algebra. An associative algebra is a set equipped with a left-module structure on a (commutative) ring, coupled with a multiplicative internal operation on the vectors of the module that is associative and distributive for the additive structure of the left-module (so giving the vectors a ring structure) and that is also bilinear under the scalar product. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:

  -| diffss(s1, s2)

axiom df-assa(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  ‚ä¢ AssAlg = { s0 ‚àà(LMod ‚ãÇ Ring)|[(Scalar ` s0)/ s1](s1 ‚àà CRing ‚àß ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(Base ` s1), ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0), ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà(Base ` s0),[(√ó ` s0)/ s5][(√ó ` s0)/ s6](((s2[s5]s3)[s6]s4)=(s2[s5](s3[s6]s4))‚àß(s3[s6](s2[s5]s4))=(s2[s5](s3[s6]s4)))))))}
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s5, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: df-asp
blocks.content: Define the algebraic span of a set of vectors in an algebra. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: df-ascl
blocks.content: Every unital algebra contains a canonical homomorphic image of its ring of scalars as scalar multiples of the unit. This names the homomorphism. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: isassa
blocks.content: The properties of an associative algebra. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: assalem
blocks.content: The properties of an associative algebra. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: issubassa
blocks.content: The subalgebras of an associative algebra are exactly the subrings (under the ring multiplication) that are simultaneously subspaces (under the scalar multiplication from the vector space). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: rlmassa
blocks.content: The ring module over a commutative ring is an associative algebra. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: assapropd
blocks.content: If two structures have the same components (properties), one is an associative algebra iff the other one is. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)

thm assapropd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àà AssAlg ‚Üî c1 ‚àà AssAlg))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 =(Base ` c0))

  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c2 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c2))‚Üí(s0[(√ó ` c0)]s1)=(s0[(√ó ` c1)]s1))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 =(Scalar ` c0))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 =(Scalar ` c1))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c2))‚Üí(s0[(√ó ` c0)]s1)=(s0[(√ó ` c1)]s1))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)

blocks.name: asplss
blocks.content: The algebraic span of a set of vectors is a vector subspace. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm asplss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wss(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), c4))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(casp, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(clss, c0))

blocks.name: rnascl

thm rnascl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  assalmod(c0)

  lspsn(hs0, hs1, c0, c3, cfv(cbs, c0), c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), cfv(cvsca, c0), cfv(csca, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  rnmpt(hs0, hs1, c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cvsca, c0), c3))
  asclfval(hs1, c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), cfv(cvsca, c0), c3, c0, cfv(csca, c0))
  eqid(cfv(csca, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)))
  eqid(cfv(cvsca, c0))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cvsca, c0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)

  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cbs, c0))

  diff.hs1.c(cfv(csca, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cvsca, c0), c3))
}

blocks.name: ressascl
blocks.content: The injection of scalars is invariant between subalgebras and superalgebras. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ressascl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(csubrg, c1)), wceq(c2, cfv(cascl, c3)))

  mpteq12dv(hs0, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c1)), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c1), cfv(cur, c1)), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c3)), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c3), cfv(cur, c3)), wcel(c0, cfv(csubrg, c1)))

  ressvsca(c0, cfv(csubrg, c1), cfv(cvsca, c1), c3, c1)
  eqidd(cv(hs0), wcel(c0, cfv(csubrg, c1)))
  subrg1(c0, c1, cfv(cur, c1), c3)
  asclfval(hs0, c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c1)), cfv(cvsca, c1), cfv(cur, c1), c1, cfv(csca, c1))
  eqid(cfv(csca, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c1)))
  eqid(cfv(cvsca, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cur, c1))
  asclfval(hs0, cfv(cascl, c3), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c3)), cfv(cvsca, c3), cfv(cur, c3), c3, cfv(csca, c3))

  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c3)))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cvsca, c3))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cur, c3))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
}

  simpr(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wcel(c1, c2))
  ad2antlr(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0)), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cfv(cur, c0), c1))
  subrg1cl(c1, c0, cfv(cur, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cur, c0))
  mpbir2and(wa(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wss(crn(c3), c1)), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(csubg, c0)), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), wral(hs1, c1, wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), c1))))

  eqeltrrd(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), c1, co(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wss(crn(c3), c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wss(crn(c3), c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))), wceq(co(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1))), wcel(c0, casa), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0)))
  simplll(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0)), wss(crn(c3), c1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)))
  simprl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wss(crn(c3), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))
  adantrl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wss(crn(c3), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0)))

  ad2antlr(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0)), wss(crn(c3), c1), wss(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  subrgss(c1, c0, cfv(cbs, c0))
  asclmul1(c0, cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0), c3, cfv(cmulr, c0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cfv(csca, c0))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wss(crn(c3), c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0))), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))), wcel(co(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), c1), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))

  sseldd(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), c1, crn(c3), wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wss(crn(c3), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)))))
  simplr(wa(wcel(c0, casa), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wss(crn(c3), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0))))

  asclfn(c3, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), c0, cfv(csca, c0))

  assalmod(c0)

thm issubassa2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà AssAlg ‚àß c1 ‚àà(SubRing ` c0))‚Üí(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚Üî ran(c3)‚äÜ c1))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(algSc ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(LSubSp ` c0)
} = {

blocks.name: asclpropd
blocks.content: If two structures have the same components (properties), one is an associative algebra iff the other one is. The last hypotheses on ` 1r ` can be discharged either by letting ` W = _V ` (if strong equality is known on ` .s ` ) or assuming ` K ` is a ring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jul-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: aspval2
blocks.content: The algebraic closure is the ring closure when the generating set is expanded to include all scalars. _EDITORIAL_ : In light of this, is ` AlgSpan ` independently needed? (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Mar-2015.)

blocks.content: Exponentiation of a scalar multiplication in an associative algebra: ` ( a .x. X ) ^ N = ( a ^ N ) .X. ( X ^ N ) ` . (Contributed by AV, 26-Aug-2019.)
